# The `WriteThroughMemoryBuffer` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This class is an extension of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">MemoryBuffer</a>, which allows write access to the underlying contents and committing those changes to the original source. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::WriteThroughMemoryBuffer</CodeBlock>

  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">MemoryBuffer</a></>}>
This interface provides simple read-only access to a block of memory, and provides simple methods for reading files and standard input into a memory buffer. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer/#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

This class is an extension of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">MemoryBuffer</a>, which allows write access to the underlying contents and committing those changes to the original source.

It only supports creation methods that are guaranteed to produce a writable buffer. For example, mapping a file read-only is not supported.

Definition at line 245 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/memorybuffer-h">MemoryBuffer.h</a>.

## Private Static Functions

### getFileAsStream() {#a76b193577aa67b1fac72cdbb5343241a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ErrorOr&lt; std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; MemoryBuffer &gt; &gt; MemoryBuffer::getFileAsStream (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Filename)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Read all of the specified file into a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">MemoryBuffer</a> as a stream (i.e.

until EOF reached). This is useful for special files that look like a regular file but have 0 size (e.g. /proc/cpuinfo on Linux).

### getOpenFile() {#a0163ef693f4fd640ec72a5fe74e5852c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ErrorOr&lt; std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; MemoryBuffer &gt; &gt; MemoryBuffer::getOpenFile (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#a8ec705e6a361f51bca14123110ecb75d">sys::fs::file&#95;t</a> FD, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Filename, uint64&#95;t FileSize, bool RequiresNullTerminator=<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#af6d5cafbdfc5313e65d990120021a3ec">true</a>, bool IsVolatile=false, std::optional&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> &gt; Alignment=std::nullopt)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Given an already-open file descriptor, read the file and return a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">MemoryBuffer</a>.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="IsVolatile">Set to true to indicate that the contents of the file can change outside the user&#39;s control, e.g. when libclang tries to parse while the user is editing/updating the file or if the file is on an NFS.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Alignment">Set to indicate that the buffer should be aligned to at least the specified alignment.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/memorybuffer-h/#l00281">281</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/memorybuffer-h">MemoryBuffer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/memorybuffer-cpp/#l00550">550</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/memorybuffer-cpp">MemoryBuffer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getOpenFileSlice() {#a4432e24dbd29bafd528e623c04c62395}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ErrorOr&lt; std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; MemoryBuffer &gt; &gt; MemoryBuffer::getOpenFileSlice (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#a8ec705e6a361f51bca14123110ecb75d">sys::fs::file&#95;t</a> FD, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Filename, uint64&#95;t MapSize, int64&#95;t Offset, bool IsVolatile=false, std::optional&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> &gt; Alignment=std::nullopt)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Given an already-open file descriptor, map some slice of it into a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">MemoryBuffer</a>.

The slice is specified by an <code>Offset</code> and <code>MapSize</code>. Since this is in the middle of a file, the buffer is not null terminated.
